total_revenue.key_context: Q3 FY25 shipping strong SaaS/OCI demand despite seasonal headwinds

cloud_services_and_license_support.notes: Strength from applications and Autonomous Database workloads

cloud_infrastructure_IaaS.notes: OCI AI consumption demand remains well above hyperscaler peers

cloud_application_SaaS.notes: Fusion and NetSuite subscriptions up mid-single digits

remaining_performance_obligations.context: Record backlog fueled by AI training/inferencing and hyperscaler-plus sovereign commitments

cash_flow.notes: Operating cash flow closely matched capex as OCI capacity was front-loaded

data_center_capacity: Expanded to 101 cloud regions; power capacity slated to double during the calendar year and triple by FY26
AI demand drove OCI consumption revenue growth of 51% (54% ex-legacy hosting)
AI_innovation: Oracle AI Data Platform brings OpenAI, xAI, Meta Llama, and other foundation models to private customer data via Database 23ai
Stargate supercluster remains on deck alongside new sovereign, hyperscale, and partner builds
applications: Fusion and Autonomous Database migrations continue to improve automation and security while boosting margins
AI agents are embedded across ERP and customer-facing applications, reinforcing modernization momentum

q4_guidance.notes: Capex guidance reflects continued OCI and sovereign cloud investments

metadata.source: Q3 FY25 press release + earnings call transcript
